website_summaries.verdict: A no-frills mattock with a heavy-duty forged head and a hardwood handle for working in the yard or garden.
pros: A two-and-a-half pound head on a long wooden handle, this is a solid, middle of the road mattock that was made for long tough days at work
Feels very strong when you hold it in your hands
cons: Quality control at the factory may be a problem since not all the handles are hardwood as they should be

customer_reviews.title: Nice. A lighter pick my wife can swing with ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice. A lighter pick my wife can swing with mallace! Now if only the handle was 8" longer I could play too. A light pick deserves a longer handle, after-all if you can't pick up a 5lb pick you probably don't bend over too good no more either, ya?
customer_reviews.author: Swany

customer_reviews.title: Not the pick I ordered
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the hardwood handle pick, but got one with a normal wood handle, with green plastic at the end where the mattock head is actually attached. I'm sure it will still work, but it's a problem when the item you purchase is not the one you receive!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great price, recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Used a lot in a short period of time. Worked splendidly. Very happy with purchase. Held up well to our rocky soils and cleared everything I wanted cleared with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa Hoelscher

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Versatile Tool
customer_reviews.text: MIne came with a nice green synthetic collar extending about 8" down from the metal head to protect from scuffing and overstrikes. I have used this to clear my yard and garden of St. Augustine grass, small volunteer trees, and many other undesirables. This tool is the perfect blend of power and weight for me, for 90% if my yard excavation work.
customer_reviews.author: steve stehr

customer_reviews.title: Hefty and durable
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat concerned, buying this online, that it might not be durable enough. But it is very well made, and hefty enough to effectively dig a hole and/or loosen the soil in some seriously hard-packed, unforgiving ground. The handle is very securely attached.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed, I have been using this for ...
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed, I have been using this for the last 2 weeks digging up tree roots, digging out rocks and trenching for a French drain. I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Held up nice, worked for what I needed it for, very pleased. The box it comes in is huge because it comes all together, not in pieces that you have to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Not to bad
customer_reviews.text: Wood handle is not the best. Might want to get fiberglass handle.
customer_reviews.author: jp y.

customer_reviews.title: Good product but short handle.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived intact. Short handle and would have been better if it was another foot longer.
customer_reviews.author: selin O

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT ORDER THIS ITEM!!! WC was ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT ORDER THIS ITEM!!! WC was right! The item you will get has the same model #, but is a much poorer quality product that Ames/True Temper is apparently now selling in its place. The blade is different, the handle is some kind of open grained mystery wood, not hickory. It has some kind of plastic collar that I suspect is to hide defects in the blade to handle join. On top of which it comes in this large box that you then have to haul back to UPS. .
customer_reviews.author: mountain ambler

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again for light yard work
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected I had some light yard work turning the soil small area
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... roots from tree stumps and this one has been super valuable.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pickaxe to break up underground roots from tree stumps and this one has been super valuable.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Goehl

customer_reviews.title: Light yet strong
customer_reviews.text: I'm not Paul Beynon. And it has served me quite well and is inexpensive... Very well made. If you need a pick ake, start here.
customer_reviews.author: Tcat

customer_reviews.title: True Temper Garden Pick with 36-inch Hickory handle
customer_reviews.text: This is just the right weight for me, making it easy to get the weeds out of my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Joan C. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: A well made tool that does what it was designed to do.
customer_reviews.text: A well made tool that does what it was designed to do. Both a garden spike and a garden hoe, it comes ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Good Pick-axe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pick axe. I've used it to cut into sod, break up tree roots, everything I needed it for it's done well.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Ann Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Right weight and good balance for my wife to use in her garden.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The tool was as advertised. The shipping was prompt. No down side for this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. Sans

customer_reviews.title: Great for spray around fondation of home trenching before applaction - just like the pros
customer_reviews.text: the price is half what you pay at home depot or lowes
customer_reviews.author: smw

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed in crooked pick head
customer_reviews.text: Pick head was not mounted straight and fully onto green plastic portion of handle, very disappointed. Side note , pick head is made in India.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: but I was able to put an edge on it fairly easily. I tore up about 300 sq feet of ...
customer_reviews.text: The only negative to this Pick is the plastic guard where the handle meets the head. There is no use for it. The metal isn't forged perfectly, but I was able to put an edge on it fairly easily. I tore up about 300 sq feet of dirt to a depth of about 5 inches with it fairly easily. I needed to get some crab grass roots up so I could replace it with a kinder, gentler grass. I busted up my dad's pick helping him in his yard, so I passed this on to him in favor of a Pulaski. If I didn't love my Pulaski, I'd certainly feel good using this Pick.
customer_reviews.author: A Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Strong and light! Won't tire you out as you mine the back 40!
customer_reviews.author: vince

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Bait and Switch!
customer_reviews.text: Don't order, Amazon will send you Ames True Temper Cutter Mattock with 36-Inch Wood Handle 1194400, which is a piece of junk! I had an important garden project planned for the weekend, and thought I was going to get a hickory handled garden pick that went right into a nice strong steel head, but instead got a flimsy handled item with a mostly plastic head. Love Amazon, but super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: W.C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to remove thistle from my property. A gentle swing will cut the thistle off several inches below the surface if properly aimed. We have had some rain lately so the ground is relatively soft. Two weeks ago, I'm sure I would have needed more than a gentle swing, but I believe I still would have succeeded.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence B.

customer_reviews.title: Quality control #India
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in good condition with a suspicious knot in the wooden handle. After a few days of use the handle split in two. Trying to get it replaced. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect digging tool for metal detecting and gardening.I added a 249 lb capacity magnet to the bottom of the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Just me.

product_meta.title: The AMES Companies, Inc 1194500 True Temper Garden Pick
product_meta.description:
Style:Garden Pick Mattock - Hardwood HandleUnearth roots and break up hard or clay soil thanks to the True Temper garden pick. This tool has a 2.5 lb forged and tempered steel head and is assembled on a wood handle for increased strength and rigidity. This garden pick is designed for small jobs.

AMAZON.COM
The Ames True Temper garden pick with 2-1/2 pound head weight has a mattock design perfect for digging and breaking up hard-packed garden dirt. Built for strength and durability, the head of this garden pick is made of heavy duty forged steel and the far reaching 36-inch long wood handle is made of the highest grade hickory.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Garden Pick with 36-inch Wood handle. Perfect for use to dig and grub into the hardest of earth.

See more
feature_bullets: Hardwood handle is strong and durable
Mattock design is perfect for digging and breaking up hard-packed garden dirt

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars47 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
